titleInfo.title: Survey of Roseland Terrace and Garden District, Baton Rouge, La.

mods.abstract: Cadastral map of properties in South Baton Rouge, in area now called Roseland Terrace and the Garden District, Oriented with north at top of map. Bounded on the west by Maximilian Street; on the east by S. 22nd Street; on the south by Myrtle Avenue; and on the north by the block due north of Government Street. Looking north. Shows names of some landowners. 'Property of R. Swart - Civil Engineer, 708 East Blvd., Tel. 2-3382.'--Bottom of map. Later names of some streets handwritten in red ink beside previous name: 'S. 10th St. (prev. 'Day Street'); S. 11th St. (prev. 'Mamie Street'); S. 12th St. (prev. 'Plum Street'); S. 13th St. (prev. 'Fannie Street'); S. 15th St. (prev. 'Feleciana [i.e., 'Feliciana'] Street'); S. 16th St. (prev. 'Middle Highland Road'); S. 17th St. (prev. 'Bryant Ave.'); Park Blvd. (prev. 'Golden Rod Blvd.').
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Access to unprocessed collections requires the permission of the curator, subject to Special Collectionsâ€™ Policy on Access to Unprocessed Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/about/unprocessed.html)
mods.note: William Waller Survey Collection, Mss. 3592, 3910, 4326, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
